apart.core.pools — Message Pools and Batching¶

This module gathers the components for the management of pools.

It defines a class NeighborMsgPool which models on message pool, and a class NeighborMsgPoolSet modeling a set of pools containing one NeighborMsgPool instance for each neighbor.

exception apart.core.pools.MsgPoolError[source]¶

Bases: RuntimeError

Raised when a bad request for sampling messages in pools is issued.

class apart.core.pools.NeighborMsgPool(n_min, f, node, neighbor)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class represents one message pool, following the design of our variant of cottrell mix. It is paramterd by a value nmin and f.

Parameters:
  • n_min (int) – the parameter nmin of the pool
  • f (float) – the paramter f of the pool (between 0 and 1)
  • node (Node) – the node to which this pool belongs to
  • neighbor (int) – the index (in the network) of the neighbor of node to which this pool relates.
add_dummy_msg()[source]¶

Add a dummy message in the pool.

Function provided for convenience

add_msg(m)[source]¶

Add a message in the pool

Parameters:m (LinkMsg) – the message to add
add_msgs(*args)[source]¶

Add several messages to the pool

Parameters:(list of obj (*args) – ~apart.core.messages.LinkMsg): the messages to add in the pool
remove_batch(batch)[source]¶

Remove a set of messages from the pool

Parameters:batch (dict of string->list LinkMsg) – a dict with two keys (‘reals’ and ‘dummies’), each respectively containing a list of real and dummy messages
sample_batch(k, sampling_bias=0.0)[source]¶

Randomly sample messages from the pool

Parameters:
  • k (int) – the number of messages to sample
  • sampling_bias (float, optional) – a float between 0 and 1, biasing the sampling towards real messages as it gets closer to 1 (Default: 0.0)
Returns:

a

dict with two keys (‘reals’ and ‘dummies’), each respectively containing a list of real and dummy messages
Return type:

dict of string->list LinkMsg
Raises:

MsgPoolError – if k is greater than n_available
n¶

int – The number of messages (dummy and reals counted together) currently in the pool

n_available¶

int – The number of available messages that can be taken out of the pool

That is : min(n - nmin, f * n)

n_dummy¶

int – The number of dummy messages currently in the pool

n_real¶

int – The number of real messages currently in the pool

class apart.core.pools.NeighborMsgPoolSet(n_min, f, node, neighbors)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class abstracting the set of pools (one per neighbor) managed by any given node.

An instance of this class contains as many instances of NeighborMsgPool as there node node has neighbors.

Parameters:
  • n_min (int) – the parameter nmin of the pool
  • f (float) – the paramter f of the pool (between 0 and 1)
  • node (Node) – the node to which this pool belongs to
  • neighbors (list int) – the indexes (in the network) of all neighbors of node
remove_batches(batches)[source]¶

Remove messages from the pools

Parameters:batches (dict of dict of string->list LinkMsg) – a dict indexed by neighbors, with as values dict with two keys (‘reals’ and ‘dummies’), each respectively containing a list of real and dummy messages
sample_neighbor_batches(sampling_bias=0)[source]¶

Randomly sample a set of batches, one from each neighbor pool

The number of messages sampled is automatically set to the maximum possible, i.e. to n_available.

Parameters:sampling_bias (float, optional) – a float between 0 and 1, biasing the sampling towards real messages as it gets closer to 1 (Default: 0.0)
Returns:
a
dict indexed by neighbors, with as values dict with two keys (‘reals’ and ‘dummies’), each respectively containing a list of real and dummy messages
Return type:dict of dict of string->list LinkMsg
n_available¶

int – The overall number of available messages in the pool set.

Defined as the mininum of the value n_available over all NeighborMsgPool instances.

n_real¶

int – The total number of real messages in the collection of pools
